other_tests.findings: Marked elevation of FT4 at 37.6 pmol/liter, low FT3 at 2.60 pmol/liter, and normal TSH at 1.4 mU/liter.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The thyroid test abnormalities (high serum T4 and low T3 concentrations in the presence of a normal serum TSH level) were persistent during the initial 7-month period of observation.
Over a period of 4 months, and despite treatment with sodium selenite, no changes in serum selenium levels were observed.

other_tests.findings: Peak GH response to insulin hypoglycemia was 11.2 mU/liter.
Sequencing of the SBP2 gene revealed a novel mutation (R128X).
Activity of GPx was markedly reduced in the proband.
